issues.text: If persons drawn from different sources are integrated into one class, can they be classified for purposes of promotion on the basis of their educational qualifications?

anchor.surface_text: CHANDRACHUD, J. If persons drawn from different sources are integrated into one class, can they be classified for purposes of promotion on the basis of their educational qualifications? That is the issue for consideration before us. Respondents, who are Diploma Holders in Engineering,

holdings.text: It is wrong to characterise the operation of a service rule as retrospective for the reason that it applies to existing employees. A rule which classifies such employees for promotional purposes... operates in future, in the sense that it governs the future right of promotion of those who are already in service.

anchor.surface_text: An argument which found favour with Mufti Bahauddin J.,one of the learned Judges of the Letters Patent Bench of the High Court, and which was repeated before us is that the retrospective application of the impugned rules is violative of articles 14 and 16 of the Constitution. It is difficult to appreciate this argument and impossible to accept it. It is wrong to characterise the operation of a service rule as retrospective for the reason that it applies to existing employees.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Service rules applying to existing employees govern future promotions, not past rights; no recall of promotions or reduction in pay.

holdings.text: There is always a presumption in favour of the constitutionality of an enactment and the burden is upon him who attacks it to show that there has been a clear transgression of the constitutional principles.

anchor.surface_text: There is always a presumption in favour of the constitutionality of an enactment and the burden is upon him who attacks it to show that there has been a clear transgression of the constitutional princi- ples.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Established doctrine; challengers must plead and prove facts showing discrimination; presumption that relevant factors considered.

holdings.text: Classification must be truly founded on substantial differences which distinguish persons grouped together from those left out of the group and such differential attributes must bear a just and rational relation to the object sought to be achieved.

anchor.surface_text: Classification, therefore, must be truly founded on substantial differences which distinguish persons grouped together from those left out of the group and such differential attributes must bear a just and rational relation to the object sought to be achieved.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Twin test of intelligible differentia and rational nexus applied; educational qualification provides presumptive evidence of higher mental equipment linked to administrative efficiency.

holdings.text: The classification of Assistant Engineers into Degree-holders and Diploma-holders rests [not] on any unreal or unreasonable basis... higher educational qualifications are at least presumptive evidence of a higher mental equipment.

anchor.surface_text: Judged from this point of view, it seems to us impossible to accept the respondents submission that the classification of Assistant Engineers into Degree-holders and Diploma- holders rests on any unreal or unreasonable basis. The classification, according to the appellants, was made with a view to achieving administrative efficiency in the Engineering services.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Object of efficiency; facts show increasing graduates; precedents uphold edu qual classification.

holdings.text: We are therefore of the opinion that though persons appointed directly and by promotion were integrated into a common class of Assistant Engineers, they could, for purposes of promotion to the cadre of Executive Engineers, be classified on the basis of educational qualifications.

anchor.surface_text: We are therefore of the opinion that though persons appointed directly and by promotion were integrated into a common class of Assistant Engineers, they could, for purposes of promotion to the cadre of Executive Engineers, be classified on the basis of educational qualifications.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Distinguishes Roshan Lal Tandon (source-based); edu qual independent basis; follows Narasing Rao etc.

holdings.text: The rule providing that graduates shall be eligible for such promotion to the exclusion of diploma-holders does not violate articles 14 and 16 of the Constitution and must be upheld.

anchor.surface_text: The rule providing that graduates shall be eligible for such promotion to the exclusion of diploma-holders does not violate articles 14 and 16 of the Constitution and must be upheld.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Classification reasonable under Art 14/16; nexus to efficiency; integration does not preclude further classification on edu qual.

holdings.text: Mini-classifications based on micro-distinctions are false to our egalitarian faith and only substantial and straightforward classifications plainly promoting relevant goals can have constitutional validity.
holdings.reasoning_summary: Concurring observation cautioning against excessive classification; endorses main judgment.

anchor.surface_text: An argument which found favour with Mufti Bahauddin J.,one of the learned Judges of the Letters Patent Bench of the High Court, and which was repeated before us is that the retrospective application of the impugned rules is violative of articles 14 and 16 of the Constitution. It is difficult to appreciate this argument and impossible to accept it. It is wrong to characterise the operation of a service rule as retrospective for the reason that it applies to existing employees.
For reasons indicated, we allow the appeal but there will be no order as to costs.

There is always a presumption in favour of the constitutionality of an enactment and the burden is upon him who attacks it to show that there has been a clear transgression of the constitutional princi- ples.
For reasons indicated, we allow the appeal but there will be no order as to costs.

For reasons indicated, we allow the appeal but there will be no order as to costs.
